title: Ayurvedic Remedies To Overcome A Hangover, Expert Explains
author: Sambhav Kumar
description: Dehydration is a common symptom of hangovers. Drinking plenty of water can help rehydrate your body and reduce the severity of your hangover.
cleaned_text: Ayurveda, an ancient Indian system of medicine, offers several remedies to treat hangovers. Hangovers are typically caused by excessive alcohol consumption, which can lead to dehydration, headache, nausea, fatigue and an inflammatory response in the body. In an interaction with OnlyMyHealth, Dr. Ganesh Chaudhary, an expert in ayurveda from Bihar, suggested some remedies that can help alleviate these symptoms: Drink Plenty Of Water Dehydration is a common symptom of hangovers. Drinking plenty of water can help rehydrate your body and reduce the severity of your hangover. You can also drink coconut water, which is a natural source of electrolytes and can help rehydrate your body faster. Ginger Tea Ginger is a natural anti-inflammatory and can help reduce nausea and vomiting. Drinking ginger tea can help soothe your stomach and reduce the severity of your hangover symptoms. According to Ayurveda, ginger tea is a natural remedy for treating hangovers. Hangovers are often caused by an excess of toxins in the body, which can cause headaches, nausea, and fatigue. Ginger tea is believed to help alleviate these symptoms by balancing the body's natural energies, or doshas. Lemon Water Drinking lemon water can help alkalize your body and reduce the acidity caused by alcohol consumption. It can also help detoxify your liver and promote better digestion. Triphala Churna Triphala churna is an Ayurvedic herbal powder made from three fruits, amla, haritaki, and bibhitaki. It is known for its detoxifying and rejuvenating properties and can help reduce the symptoms of a hangover. Ashwagandha As per African Journal of Traditional Complementary and Alternative Medicines, ashwagandha is an Ayurvedic herb that is known for its adaptogenic properties. It can help reduce stress and anxiety caused by a hangover and promote relaxation. Massaging With Sesame Oil Massaging your body with sesame oil can help reduce the effects of a hangover. Sesame oil is a natural source of antioxidants and can help soothe your body and promote relaxation. Pitta dosha is associated with fire and is responsible for digestion, metabolism, and transformation. Kapha dosha is associated with water and earth and is responsible for structure, lubrication, and nourishment. Also, peppermint eliminates gas from the stomach and intestines. In Ayurveda, balancing the doshas is believed to be essential for maintaining good health and preventing disease. This is achieved through lifestyle practices such as diet, exercise, meditation, and herbal remedies. In this way Ayurvedic remedies can be a natural and effective way to treat hangovers.
